title: Google\Cloud\NetworkSecurity\V1beta1\AuthorizationPolicy
name: AuthorizationPolicy
description:
AuthorizationPolicy is a resource that specifies how a server should authorize incoming connections. This resource in itself does not change the configuration unless it's attached to a target https proxy or endpoint config selector resource.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.networksecurity.v1beta1.AuthorizationPolicy

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Required. Name of the AuthorizationPolicy resource. It matches pattern projects/{project}/locations/{location}/authorizationPolicies/<authorization_policy>.

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The timestamp when the resource was created.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. The timestamp when the resource was updated.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Optional. Set of label tags associated with the AuthorizationPolicy resource.

params.name: data.action
params.description: Required. The action to take when a rule match is found. Possible values are "ALLOW" or "DENY".

params.name: data.rules
params.description: Optional. List of rules to match. Note that at least one of the rules must match in order for the action specified in the 'action' field to be taken. A rule is a match if there is a matching source and destination. If left blank, the action specified in the action field will be applied on every request.
